      • checkOutOfScreenHeight

        public int checkOutOfScreenHeight(int y,
                                  int img_height)
        Checks if given number is out of screen height bounds
        Parameters:
        y - Number to check, represents Y coordinate of object
        img_height - Height of the image representing the object
        Returns:
        If image is out of bounds then the closest coordinate possible to that bound, otherwise param pos

      • checkOutOfScreenWidth

        public int checkOutOfScreenWidth(int x,
                                 int img_width)
        Checks if given number is out of screen width bounds
        Parameters:
        x - Number to check, represents X coordinate of object
        img_width - Height of the image representing the object
        Returns:
        If image is out of bounds then the closest coordinate possible to that bound, otherwise param pos

        Loads the map
        Parameters:
        map_name - Name of the .tmx file
        collision_name - Name of the collision layer

      • mapPosToPixels

        public Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> mapPosToPixels(Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> map_pos)
        Converts from TiledMap tile position to respective pixel position
        Parameters:
        map_pos - Position of the Tile of the Map
        Returns:
        Equivalent position in screen pixels It always returns the correspondent bottom left corner of the tile

      • collidesBottom

        public int collidesBottom(Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> pos,
                          int img_width)
        Checks if the position collides with something below
        Parameters:
        pos - Position to check
        img_width - Width of the image representing the object
        Returns:
        The Y coordinate the object should go if it collides, -1 if it does not collide It checks every bottom position of Mario in case it is colliding with multiple objects in order to get upper y coordinate

      • collidesLeft

        public int collidesLeft(Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> pos,
                        int img_height)
        Checks if the position collides with something on the left
        Parameters:
        pos - Position to check
        img_height - Height of the image representing the object
        Returns:
        The X coordinate the object should go if it collides, -1 if it does not collide It checks every left position of Mario in case it is colliding with multiple objects in order to get highest x coordinate

      • nearLadder

        public int nearLadder(int x,
                      int y)
        Checks if there is a ladder in the given position
        Parameters:
        x - X pixel coordinate of the object
        y - Y pixel coordinate of the object
        Returns:
        X pixel coordinate where the player should will go to start climbing ladder, it is the middle of the ladder. -1 if no ladder is near

      • canUseLadder

        public boolean canUseLadder(int x,
                            int y)
        Checks if the ladder in the given position is usable
        Parameters:
        x - X pixel coordinate of the object
        y - Y pixel coordinate of the object
        Returns:
        Whether the object can use the ladder or not

      • closestLowerStair

        public int closestLowerStair(int x,
                             int y)
        Searches for the closest lower stair from the given start position
        Parameters:
        x - X pixel coordinate in pixels of object
        y - Y pixel coordinate in pixels of object
        Returns:
        X coordinate in Tiles of closest lower ladder

      • closestUpperStair

        public int closestUpperStair(int x,
                             int y)
        Searches for the closest upper stair from the given start position
        Parameters:
        x - X pixel coordinate in pixels of object
        y - Y pixel coordinate in pixels of object
        Returns:
        X coordinate in Tiles of closest upper ladder

      • checkLevelDifference

        public int checkLevelDifference(Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> origin,
                                Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> dest)
        Compares given positions and returns a number that represents where the destination position is
        Parameters:
        origin - The position to start looking in pixels
        dest - The position to try to reach in pixels
        Returns:
        0 -> same level, 1 upper ladder connected to level, 2 upper level, 3 at least 2 upper levels, -1 lower ladder connected to level, -2 lower level, -3 at least 2 bottom levels

      • setScale

        public void setScale(float scale)
        Sets the map scaling
        Parameters:
        scale - Scale of the map

      • ladderInPosition

        public Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> ladderInPosition(Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> pos,
                                                                  int img_width,
                                                                  int x_speed)
        Checks if there is a ladder below the given crane
        Parameters:
        pos - Position in which to check for ladder, in pixels
        img_width - Width of the image of the object querying about the ladder
        x_speed - Size of the interval of X coordinates to return, corresponds to the object X velocity
        Returns:
        An interval of X coordinates where object should be in order to go down ladder, [-1,-1] if there is no ladder

      • XConverter

        public int XConverter(float x)
        Converts from pixel coordinates to tile coordinates
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate in pixels
        Returns:
        X coordinate in tiles

      • YConverter

        public int YConverter(float y)
        Converts from pixel coordinates to tile coordinates
        Parameters:
        y - Y coordinate in pixels
        Returns:
        Y coordinate in tiles
